conversations.title: Conversations
conversations.selectConversationDescription: Choose a conversation from the list to start chatting
conversations.adjustFilters: Start a new conversation or adjust filters

contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.name: Name
contacts.noContactsDescription: Add your first contact to get started

channels.title: Channels
channels.connectNewChannels: Connect new communication channels to your account
channels.addFirstChannel: Add your first channel to start receiving messages
channels.deleteChannelDescription: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This action cannot be undone. All conversations and messages associated with this channel will be preserved but the channel will no longer receive new messages.
channels.configNotAvailable: Configuration not available for this channel type.

config.channelNameDesc: A friendly name to identify this channel
config.deviceNameDesc: Name shown in WhatsApp linked devices
config.multiDeviceDesc: This connection uses WhatsApp multi-device protocol. Your phone doesn't need to stay online after initial setup.
config.channelCreatedDesc: WhatsApp channel "{name}" has been created successfully.
config.channelUpdatedDesc: WhatsApp channel "{name}" has been updated successfully.
config.accessTokenDesc: Permanent access token from Meta Developer Portal
config.phoneNumberIdDesc: Found in WhatsApp Business API settings
config.businessIdDesc: Your WhatsApp Business Account ID from Meta Business Suite
config.enterCredentialsFirst: Please enter access token and phone number ID first
config.checkCredentials: Could not connect to WhatsApp API. Please check your credentials.
config.webhookUrlDesc: Configure this URL in Meta Developer Portal
config.verifyTokenDesc: Use this token when configuring the webhook in Meta Developer Portal
config.appSecretDesc: App Secret from Meta Developer Portal for webhook signature verification
config.securityRecommendationDesc: Configure the App Secret to enable HMAC-SHA256 signature verification for webhook requests. This ensures messages are genuinely from Meta.
config.setupGuideDesc: Follow these steps to configure WhatsApp Business Cloud API
config.step1Desc: Go to Meta Developer Portal and create a new app with WhatsApp Business API
config.step2Desc: Add the WhatsApp product to your app and configure a test phone number
config.step3Desc: Create a permanent access token in the API Setup section
config.step4Desc: Set up the webhook URL and subscribe to the 'messages' field
config.step4Details1: Webhook URL: Use the URL from the Webhook tab
config.step4Details2: Verify Token: Use the token from the Webhook tab
config.step5Desc: Send a test message from your phone to verify the setup
config.messagingWindowDesc: WhatsApp enforces a 24-hour customer service window. You can only send free-form messages within 24 hours of the last customer message. Outside this window, you must use pre-approved template messages.
config.connectAccount: Connect your WhatsApp account to receive messages
config.enterPairCode: Enter this code in WhatsApp > Linked Devices
config.enterPhoneForPairCode: Please enter your phone number to use pair code login
config.saveFirstDesc: Save the channel configuration first, then connect your WhatsApp.
config.howToStep4: Scan the QR code or enter the pair code
config.customizeWidget: Customize how the chat widget looks
config.welcomeMessagePlaceholder: Hello! How can we help you today?
config.autoOpenDesc: Automatically open the chat widget after a delay
config.typingIndicatorDesc: Show when the agent or bot is typing
config.allowedDomainsDesc: One domain per line. Leave empty to allow all domains.
config.embedCodeDesc: Add this code to your website to display the chat widget
config.embedCodePlacement: Place this code just before the closing {tag} tag on your website.
config.botUsernameDesc: Your bot username (without @). Will be auto-detected if not provided.
config.webhookAutoSetupDesc: Linktor will automatically configure the webhook with Telegram when you save this channel. You don't need to manually set up the webhook.
config.webhookAutoConfigured: This URL will be automatically configured when you save the channel
config.telegramSetupGuide: Follow these steps to create a Telegram Bot
config.telegramStep1Desc: Start a chat with @BotFather on Telegram
config.telegramStep2Desc: Send /newbot command and follow the prompts to create your bot
config.telegramStep3Desc: BotFather will give you a token that looks like 123456789:ABCdefGHIjklmNOPQrstUVwxyz
config.telegramStep4Desc: Use /setcommands, /setdescription, and /setabouttext to customize your bot
config.telegramStep5Desc: Enter the bot token in the Credentials tab above
config.botCommandsDesc: You can configure bot commands with BotFather using /setcommands. Common commands include /start for greeting new users and /help for assistance.
config.phoneNumberE164: Your Twilio number in E.164 format
config.messagingServiceSidDesc: Messaging Service SID from Twilio Console
config.useMsgServiceDesc: Use a Messaging Service for better deliverability and A2P 10DLC compliance
config.configureUrlInTwilio: Configure this URL in your Twilio phone number settings
config.statusCallbackDesc: For delivery status updates (optional but recommended)
config.webhookConfigurationDesc: Configure the webhook URL in Twilio Console under Phone Numbers > Manage Numbers > Active Numbers > [Your Number] > Messaging section.
config.twilioSetupGuide: Follow these steps to set up Twilio SMS
config.twilioStep1Desc: Sign up for a Twilio account if you don't have one
config.twilioStep2Desc: Find your Account SID and Auth Token in the Console Dashboard
config.twilioStep3Desc: Purchase a phone number or use a Messaging Service to send SMS
config.twilioStep4Desc: Set up the incoming messages webhook URL in your phone number settings
config.twilioStep4Details1: Navigate to: Phone Numbers > Manage > Active Numbers
config.twilioStep4Details2: Set "A MESSAGE COMES IN" to the Webhook URL
config.twilioStep5Desc: Send a test SMS to your Twilio number to verify the setup
config.a2p10dlcDesc: If you're sending SMS to US numbers, consider using a Messaging Service with A2P 10DLC registration for better deliverability and compliance.
config.sendgridApiKeyAlert: Make sure your API key has "Mail Send" permissions and your from email is verified.
config.sesSettingsDesc: Configure your Amazon Simple Email Service credentials
config.sesAlert: Make sure your IAM user has SES permissions and your from email is verified in SES console.
config.postmarkAlert: Make sure your sender signature is verified in Postmark.
config.imapSettingsDesc: Configure IMAP to receive emails. Leave blank to use webhooks only.
config.sendgridInboundDesc: Configure SendGrid Inbound Parse to receive emails.
config.mailgunInboundDesc: Configure Mailgun Routes to receive emails.
config.sesInboundDesc: Configure SES receipt rules to forward to SNS.
config.postmarkInboundDesc: Configure Postmark Inbound to receive emails.
config.webhookUrlsDesc: Configure these URLs in your email provider dashboard to receive events and inbound emails.
config.snsEndpointDesc: Create an SNS topic, subscribe this HTTPS endpoint, then configure SES to publish events to that topic.
config.smtpImapNote: SMTP provider uses IMAP polling for receiving emails. No webhook configuration is required.
config.instagramIdDesc: Your Instagram Business Account ID (not the username)
config.accessTokenInstagramDesc: Access Token from Instagram API with instagram_manage_messages permission
config.appIdDesc: Facebook App ID (for webhook signature validation)
config.appSecretOptionalDesc: App Secret for webhook signature validation
config.verifyTokenGenDesc: Used to verify webhook requests from Instagram
config.instagramOauthAlert: Instagram Business accounts must be connected via Facebook. Enter your Facebook App credentials.
config.chooseInstagramAccount: Choose which Instagram account to connect
config.noInstagramAccountsDesc: Make sure your Instagram Business account is connected to a Facebook Page.
config.instagramSetupGuide: Follow these steps to set up Instagram DM integration
config.instagramStep1Desc: Instagram messaging requires a Facebook App with Instagram permissions
config.instagramStep2Desc: In your app dashboard, add the Instagram Messaging product
config.instagramStep3Desc: Connect your Instagram Professional account to a Facebook Page
config.instagramStep4Desc: Generate an access token with instagram_basic and instagram_manage_messages permissions
config.instagramStep5Desc: Add the webhook URL from the Webhook tab and subscribe to messages events
config.instagramRequirementsDesc: Instagram messaging requires an Instagram Professional account (Business or Creator) connected to a Facebook Page. Personal accounts are not supported.
config.instagramWebhookConfig: In your Facebook App settings, configure the Instagram webhook with this URL and subscribe to: messages, message_reactions, messaging_seen
config.facebookOauthAlert: The easiest way to connect your Facebook Page. Enter your App credentials and click Connect.
config.chooseFacebookPage: Choose which Facebook Page to connect
config.pageAccessTokenDesc: Page Access Token with messaging permissions
config.facebookSetupGuide: Follow these steps to set up Facebook Messenger integration
config.facebookStep1Desc: Go to Facebook for Developers and create a new app
config.facebookStep2Desc: In your app dashboard, add the Messenger product
config.facebookStep3Desc: In Messenger Settings, connect your Page and generate a Page Access Token
config.facebookStep4Desc: Add the webhook URL and verify token from the Webhook tab above
config.facebookStep5Desc: Subscribe your webhook to messages, messaging_postbacks, message_deliveries, and message_reads events
config.facebookWebhookConfig: In your Facebook App settings, add this webhook URL and select the following fields: messages, messaging_postbacks, message_deliveries, message_reads
config.facebookPermissionsDesc: Your app needs the pages_messaging permission. You may need to complete App Review for production use.
config.selectRcsProvider: Select your RCS Business Messaging provider
config.zenviaAgentIdDesc: Your Zenvia RCS Agent ID from the console
config.apiTokenDesc: Your Zenvia API token for authentication
config.customSenderIdDesc: Custom sender ID for outgoing messages
config.pontaltechApiSecretDesc: Your Pontaltech API secret for signing requests
config.googleAgentIdDesc: Your Google RCS Business Messaging Agent ID
config.serviceAccountJsonDesc: Paste your Google Cloud service account JSON credentials
config.saveConfigFirstDesc: Save your credentials to get the webhook URL for your channel.
config.configureWebhookInProvider: Configure this webhook URL in your {provider} dashboard:
config.zenviaSetup2: Navigate to your RCS agent settings
config.zenviaSetup3: Set the webhook URL above as callback URL
config.infobipSetup3: Add the webhook URL for incoming messages
config.infobipSetup4: Add the webhook URL for delivery reports
config.pontaltechSetup2: Provide the webhook URL for configuration
config.pontaltechSetup3: Request the webhook secret for validation
config.googleSetup1: Go to the Google Business Communications console
config.googleSetup2: Navigate to your RCS agent settings
config.googleSetup3: Set the webhook URL in Agent Information
config.voiceProviderDesc: Select your telephony provider for voice calls
config.recordCallsDesc: Automatically record all calls for quality and training
config.transcribeCallsDesc: Convert speech to text for analysis and search
config.configureVoiceProvider: Configure your voice provider to send events to this URL
config.webhookSecurityDesc: Configure webhook signature verification in your provider's dashboard for secure communication.
config.twilioVoiceSetup2: Go to Phone Numbers → Manage → Active Numbers
config.twilioVoiceSetup4: Under Voice & Fax, set "A call comes in" to Webhook
config.vonageSetup3: Select or create your Voice application
config.vonageSetup4: Under Capabilities → Voice, set the Answer URL
config.vonageSetup6: Set the Event URL for call status updates
config.amazonConnectSetup1: Open Amazon Connect in AWS Console
config.amazonConnectSetup4: Create or edit a contact flow
config.amazonConnectSetup6: Configure Lambda to forward to webhook URL
config.asteriskSetup2: Add AGI or ARI application to handle calls
config.asteriskSetup3: Configure the application to connect to webhook URL
config.freeswitchSetup2: Configure ESL password to match above
config.freeswitchSetup3: Add outbound socket in dialplan for webhook
config.configSavedDesc: The channel has been configured successfully.

observability.consumerResetSuccess: The consumer has been reset successfully

settings.emailNotificationsDesc: Receive email notifications for important events
settings.pushNotificationsDesc: Receive push notifications in your browser
settings.changePasswordDesc: Update your password regularly to keep your account secure
settings.twoFactorAuthDesc: Add an extra layer of security to your account
